briefdescription.para: Major version of RapidJSON in integer.
Minor version of RapidJSON in integer.
Patch version of RapidJSON in integer.
Version of RapidJSON in "<major>.<minor>.<patch>" string format.

detaileddescription.para: In order to avoid symbol clashes and/or "One Definition Rule" errors between multiple inclusions of (different versions of) RapidJSON in a single binary, users can customize the name of the main RapidJSON namespace.

In case of a single nesting level, defining RAPIDJSON_NAMESPACE to a custom name (e.g. MyRapidJSON) is sufficient. If multiple levels are needed, both RAPIDJSON_NAMESPACE_BEGIN and RAPIDJSON_NAMESPACE_END need to be defined as well:

x
pointer to align
Some machines require strict data alignment. Currently the default uses 4 bytes alignment. User can customize by defining the RAPIDJSON_ALIGN function macro.

briefdescription.para: Construct a 64-bit literal by a pair of 32-bit integer.

detaileddescription.para: 64-bit literal with or without ULL suffix is prone to compiler warnings. UINT64_C() is C macro which cause compilation problems. Use this macro to define 64-bit constants by a pair of 32-bit integer.
By default, rapidjson uses C assert() for internal assertions. User can override it by defining RAPIDJSON_ASSERT(x) macro.

simplesect.para: Parsing errors are handled and can be customized by the RapidJSON error handling APIs.

briefdescription.para: (Internal) macro to check for conditions at compile-time
Size type (for string lengths, array sizes, etc.)

detaileddescription.para: RapidJSON uses 32-bit array/string indices even on 64-bit platforms, instead of using size_t. Users may override the SizeType by defining RAPIDJSON_NO_SIZETYPEDEFINE.

briefdescription.para: Insitu string stream with UTF8 encoding.
Put N copies of a character to a stream.
